thread.title: Nerdgirl: Geeking out about that Jeannie bottle
thread.title_full: Nerdgirl: Geeking out about that Jeannie bottle

title: Nerdgirl: Geeking out about that Jeannie bottle
text:
Nerdgirl: Geeking out about that Jeannie bottle Jennifer Sangalang , FLORIDA TODAY 12:07 p.m. EDT October 16, 2015 Here's my "I Dream of Jeannie" bottle, Flat Stanley-style. Buy Photo Shown is the medal for the Cocoa Beach Half Marathon, which, in part, celebrates "I Dream of Jeannie" actress Barbara Eden. (Photo: JENNIFER SANGALANG/FLORIDA TODAY) Buy Photo 
Flat Stanley, meet "I Dream of Jeannie." 
Well, sort of. I took a page out of my kid's old elementary school assignment and tweaked it for #Nerdgirl. This week, I'm geeking out about my "I Dream of Jeannie"/Cocoa Beach Half Marathon Jeannie bottle medal. I took various pictures of it in different scenarios: at home, on the job and just for fun. 
Race director Mitch Varnes was on board with this project — those who finish the race Oct. 25 will get a medal, too. 'Jeannie' exhibit on display at history center 
All of my subjects recognized the iconic bottle of the popular '60s TV show, which celebrates its 50th anniversary this year. "Jeannie" herself, actress Barbara Eden, returns to Brevard on Oct. 25, and based on the feedback we're getting, people are stoked about it. Seriously stoked. Varnes is hosting a Jeannie lookalike contest (do you have what it takes?) and has a few surprises for runners and spectators. 
Check back with FLORIDA TODAY and floridatoday.com for our #IDreamOfJeannie coverage. 
Here are my favorite pics from my little project. 
On the cleanest part of my desk at work. 
Near Atlantic Avenue in Cocoa Beach Buy Photo 
The Dinosaur Store in Cocoa Beach Buy Photo 
The Dinosaur Store in Cocoa Beach (Photo: JENNIFER SANGALANG/FLORIDA TODAY) 
At FLORIDA TODAY's Pink Lemonade Stand on Oct. 2. Buy Photo 
FLORIDA TODAY hosted a pink lemonade stand Oct. 2, raising money for a local charity. (Photo: JENNIFER SANGALANG/FLORIDA TODAY) 
I ran into Santa at the Signature Chefs Auction in Melbourne on Oct. 6. Buy Photo 
Santa Claus was making the rounds at the Signature Chefs Auction at Hilton Melbourne Rialto on Oct. 6. (Photo: JENNIFER SANGALANG/FLORIDA TODAY) 
Noel Senina was the deejay at the Ilang Ilang Gala at the Eau Gallie Civic Center on Oct. 3. I emceed the fundraiser for the Space Coast Filipino-American Charitable and Educational Foundation, and Noel definitely entertained the crowd. Buy Photo 
Noel Senina, who entertained during the Ilang Ilang Gala at the Eau Gallie Civic Center on Oct. 3. (Photo: JENNIFER SANGALANG/FLORIDA TODAY) 
With Romeo de la Paz of SCFACEF. De la Paz is a Filipino rights champion in Brevard. Buy Photo 
Romeo de la Paz, a local champion of Filipino rights (Photo: JENNIFER SANGALANG/FLORIDA TODAY) 
In the pressroom at FLORIDA TODAY on Sept. 30, the day before our Health section was printed on pink paper, in honor of Breast Cancer Awareness Month. And FLORIDA TODAY's special coverage highlighting cancer heroes and champions. Buy Photo 
#321GoPink at FLORIDA TODAY -- this is the pressroom (Photo: JENNIFER SANGALANG/FLORIDA TODAY) 
Here's the pink paper! Buy Photo 
It was #321GoPink at FLORIDA TODAY on Oct. 1. Shown is the pink paper -- some of our sections were printed on pink newsprint. (Photo: JENNIFER SANGALANG/FLORIDA TODAY) 
My karate classmate Lloyd Brownhill of Melbourne Buy Photo 
Lloyd Brownhill, a brown belt karate student, of Ueshiro Shorin-Ryu Karate U.S.A. (Photo: JENNIFER SANGALANG/FLORIDA TODAY) 
At the movies — Carmike Cinemas at the Avenue in Viera. Buy Photo 
The Avenue in Viera near Carmike Cinemas (Photo: JENNIFER SANGALANG/FLORIDA TODAY) 
Carmike Cinemas (with the flash) Buy Photo 
The Avenue in Viera near Carmike Cinemas (Photo: JENNIFER SANGALANG/FLORIDA TODAY) 
Avenue's Central Park with the stage in the background Buy Photo 
Central Park at the Avenue in Viera (Photo: JENNIFER SANGALANG/FLORIDA TODAY) 
At Port Everglades in Fort Lauderdale: My mom recently visited and went on a cruise there. I gently reminded her of Port Canaveral and its proximity to our house, but at least I got a chance to visit this port. Buy Photo 
Port Everglades at Fort Lauderdale (Photo: JENNIFER SANGALANG/FLORIDA TODAY) 
Port Everglades at Fort Lauderdale (Photo: JENNIFER SANGALANG/FLORIDA TODAY) 
Ron Jon Surf Shop at night Buy Photo 
Ron Jon Surf Shop in Cocoa Beach (Photo: JENNIFER SANGALANG/FLORIDA TODAY) 
A nighttime visit to Cocoa Beach Buy Photo 
Cocoa Beach (Photo: JENNIFER SANGALANG/FLORIDA TODAY) 
Ice Cream Junction and Oriental Food Mart in Cocoa Beach, for some Filipino food (Mom was in town) and ice cream and halo-halo, a traditional Filipino shaved ice treat, for dessert. Buy Photo 
Ice Cream Junction and Oriental Food Mart in Cocoa Beach (Photo: JENNIFER SANGALANG/FLORIDA TODAY) 
Lori Claro, left, and Cristine Befanis supported FLORIDA TODAY's Pink Lemonade Stand. Buy Photo 
Lori Claro, left, and Cristine Befanis of Brevard Random Acts of Kindness (Photo: JENNIFER SANGALANG/FLORIDA TODAY) 
Romeo de la Paz, a local champion of Filipino rights (Photo: JENNIFER SANGALANG/FLORIDA TODAY) 
Extra extra! FLORIDA TODAY went pink, #321GoPink Buy Photo 
#321GoPink -- the Oct. 1 edition of FLORIDA TODAY's Health section was printed on pink paper. More sections of the Oct. 2 edition were printed on pink paper. (Photo: JENNIFER SANGALANG/FLORIDA TODAY) 

... Some Jeannie extras ... 
"On the Magic Carpet with Barbara Eden" will be staged at at 6:45 p.m. Oct. 25 at Holy Trinity Episcopal Academy, 5625 Holy Trinity Drive, Melbourne. General admission tickets are $39, and meet-and-greet tickets are $99. Tickets are available only through events.com . 

What: "I Dream of Jeannie" exhibit 
When: Hours are 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. Tuesday through Friday, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Saturdays and noon to 4 p.m. Sundays 
Where: Air Force Space and Missile History Center, 100 Spaceport Way, Cape Canaveral 
Cost: Admission is free, and no Cape access pass is required. 
Info: Call 321-853-9171 or visit afspacemuseum.org . 
-
